intro: Cephalomappa lepidotula, commonly known as the velvetleaf mallow, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It features palmately lobed leaves that are often covered in a dense, velvety pubescence, giving it its common name. The plant produces clusters of small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and waste areas. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive member of the Malvaceae family.
